1 ^ Dòmine: 2 ^ Qụi ingréditur sine mácula et operátur justìțiam
¿~qụìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: qụi lóqụitur veritátem in corde suo
aŭt qụìs reqụiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: ^ He who walketh without blemish and worketh justice
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: who speaketh truth in his heart

1 ^ Dòmine: 3 ^ qụi non eģit dolum in lingụa sua
aŭt qụìs reqụiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: et oppróbrium non accépit advèrsus pròximos suos. ^ who hath not used deceit in his tongue
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: nor hath done evil to his neighbour
or who shall rest in thy holy hill~?: and hath not taken up a reproach against his neighbours.

1 ^ Dòmine: 4 ^ Ad nìhilum dedúctus est in conspèctu ejus malìgnus~; timèntes aŭtem Dòminum glorìficat. Qụi jurat pròximo suo et non décipit
¿~qụìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: ^ In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing
aŭt qụìs reqụiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour and deceiveth not

1 ^ Dòmine: 5 ^ qụi pecúniam suam non dèdit ad usúram
¿~qụìs habitábit in tabernáculo tuo: et múnera super innocèntem non accépit~; qụi façit haĕc
aŭt qụìs reqụiéscet in mònte sancto tuo: non movébitur in aĕtèrnum. ^ he that hath not put out his money to usury
who shall dwell in thy tabernacle: nor taken bribes against the innocent~; he that doth these things
or who shall rest in thy holy hill~?: shall not be moved for ever.
